ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri engineering
ResearchProjectDef.description: Begin adapting off-world Tau'ri tech: field equipment, comms, and just enough military-grade hardware to get the IOA very concerned.\n\nThe first step is to formalize Tau'ri-grade research workflows: networked desks, blueprint tables, and enough humming hardware to make every experiment feel classified. Dramatically increases research throughput.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tauri Manufacturing
ResearchProjectDef.description:
The Goa'uld and Wraith scavenge, repurpose, and falsely claim technology as their own. The Tau'ri? They build it themselves, with a healthy load of brackets, adapters, and shielding. 

By standardizing fabrication fixtures—crystal mounts, subcore regulators, hardened power buses, and “do not touch” interlocks—your engineers can safely assemble Ancient-adjacent hardware using human industry. Nothing elegant. Nothing alive. Just reliable, serviceable machinery that won’t vaporize the operator if wired correctly. 

Establishes a foundation for Tau'ri-pattern manufacturing and unlocks dedicated production equipment and construction materials.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
Your engineers have finalized Tau'ri-pattern fabrication standards.

With proper mounts, regulators, and enough shielding to make a safety officer cry, the colony can now assemble complex offworld hardware without guesswork—or explosions. 

Human engineering wins again: inelegant, overbuilt, and dependable.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri Uniforms
ResearchProjectDef.description: Standard-issue SGC uniforms and armor rated for both firefights and diplomatic blunders. Includes extra pockets for snacks, Zat holsters, and moral ambiguity.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri Advanced Armor
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock advanced Tau'ri armor technologies and the true potential of the composition bench. Because sometimes, diplomacy fails and you need to survive the fallout.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri weapons I
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock pulse-pounding, projectile-slinging freedom—courtesy of Earth’s finest ballistic engineering.\nWarning: may provoke Goa’uld, Wraith, and anyone with plasma-based superiority complexes.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri weapons II
ResearchProjectDef.description: Advances in Tau’ri weapons engineering bring the next generation of battlefield tools into your arsenal. Building on prior designs, this tier delivers more specialized options, improved stopping power, and refined technology for dealing with threats at any range. The Goa’uld call it escalation. The Tau’ri call it preparedness.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri turrets I
ResearchProjectDef.description: Field up your defenses the Tau’ri way: a manned, shielded M2 that turns negotiations into noise. Teaches emplacement, feed, and “brace for recoil.”

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri turrets II
ResearchProjectDef.description: Apply refined naquadah to rail physics and call it “security.” Unlocks a manned railgun that ventilates armor and egos at extreme range.

ResearchProjectDef.label: MALP mech tech
ResearchProjectDef.description: By tearing down a ruined Tau’ri MALP and tracing its signal routing, your researchers believe they can build a locally manufacturable probe with sturdier parts and less mystery.\n\nWe won’t have their classified control stack, so we’ll have to figure it out ourselves — and make it better.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: The ruined Tau’ri MALP wasn’t a total loss. Its cabling, crystal mounts, and actuator layout tell a clear story: we can fabricate a ruggedized copy that runs on our tools, our power, and our patience.\n\nIt won’t match the Tau’ri’s classified control stack, but it’ll drive, probe, and—most importantly—go through the Dwarfgate first.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Naquadria power
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock a compact, high-yield power generator fueled by weaponized star dust. Enough energy to power a base—or vaporize one by accident.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Naquadria engineering
ResearchProjectDef.description: Advanced Tau'ri naquadria power engineering. Unlocks a heavily shielded, industrial-scale reactor capable of powering full complexes, deep-space platforms, and that one colonist who insists on running forty neural superchargers at once.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri medical procedures
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlocks Tau'ri medical protocols: triage techniques, surgical procedures, and field treatments adapted from off-world military medicine.\n\nDramatically improves medical care quality and survival rates for severe injuries.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tretonin synthesis
ResearchProjectDef.description:
Unlocks the secrets of Tretonin, a breakthrough serum reverse-engineered from Goa'uld symbiote research.

Provides total immunity to disease—at the cost of permanent biochemical dependency.

Tau'ri scientists call it a miracle. Symbiotes call it unemployment.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
After countless enzyme failures, biochemical meltdowns, and one unfortunate volunteer incident, your researchers have succeeded in stabilizing the Tretonin compound.

Derived from Goa'uld symbiote enzymes, the serum grants total immunity to disease—so long as the subject never stops taking it.

The Tau’ri call it a medical revolution. The Tok’ra call it a bad idea. Both are right.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Synthesis advancements
ResearchProjectDef.description: The Ancient's left extensive notes on biochemistry. Using these as reference, it should be possible to optimize and refine the Tretonin synthesis protocols to remove the biochemical dependency that requires a symbiote for processing the serum.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Building on prior research and Ancient biochemistry notes, your team has refined the Tretonin synthesis process to eliminate the biochemical dependency on symbiote enzymes.\n\nThe new formulation provides the same robust immunity to disease without the need for ongoing symbiote interaction—marking a significant advancement in medical science.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tracked cart
ResearchProjectDef.description: Blueprints for a compact, tracked haul platform—part motor-pool ingenuity, part “don’t ask what’s in the crate.” Chemfuel-powered, stable on rough ground, and perfect for dragging too much loot back to base without rupturing a colonist’s spine.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Refrigerated lining
ResearchProjectDef.description: Blueprints for refrigerated lining upgrades for carts. Keeps perishable goods fresh during long hauls through hot environments—because even in the far reaches of the galaxy, nobody wants spoiled food.
